meanings.definition: A type of fine-grained sedimentary rock.
meanings.sent1: The geologist studied the wacke under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The hiker found interesting wacke formations along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The wacke rock looked like a tiny mountain in the palm of his hand.
meanings.sent4: The wacke cliffs stood tall, like ancient guardians of the valley.
meanings.sent5: The wacke's layers told stories of the Earth's history.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally wacked his thumb with the hammer.
meanings.sent2: The boxer aimed to wacke his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to wacke him with a pillow fight.
meanings.sent4: The storm wacked the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The chef's knife wacked through the vegetables effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Lacking in quality or value; inferior.
meanings.sent1: The store sold wacke products that no one wanted to buy.
meanings.sent2: She received a wacke gift that she politely thanked the giver for.
meanings.sent3: The comedian made a wacke joke that fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: His excuses for being late were wacke, to say the least.
meanings.sent5: The old car was wacke, barely able to make it up the hill.
